headline: Spanish Rice Bake
description: Ground beef, fresh onion, green bell pepper, tomatoes and rice are simmered in a sweet-hot sauce then baked with Cheddar and garnished with fresh cilantro.

video.description: Easy rice casserole full of flavor!
video.name: Spanish Rice Bake

name: Spanish Rice Bake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Brown the ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drain excess fat and transfer beef to a large pot over medium low heat.. Stir in the onion, green bell pepper, tomatoes, water, rice, chile sauce, salt, brown sugar, cumin, Worcestershire sauce and ground black pepper.
Let this simmer for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, then transport this to a 2-quart casserole dish. Press down firmly and sprinkle with the shredded Cheddar cheese.
Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 10 to 15 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.

review.reviewBody: Really tasty ground beef casserole. I did add some extra seasoning garlic, onion powder etc. I did cut the chili sauce in half, (not good with really spicy) it had just the right amount of heat. Also used my cast iron skillet and had only one pan to clean, easy, fast and yummyðŸ˜‹ I will definitely make this again.

i made this and it was delicious. Changes I made was i used reg white rice , added green onion with the sweet onion and i made this in a cast iron skillet and then put the skillet into the oven for convenience and flavor. Definitely will do this one again.
I used to make this as written and it's good. However we like some spice in Spanish rice which this recipe has none. So I add extras for some heat.

Made this with some leftover ground beef and cooked rice. Followed most of the directions but didn't need all the water to cook the rice. Let it simmer together. Next time I will add the meat to the rice to pull in the flavors. I also removed tomatoes since kids don't like it and added jalapenos for some spice. Great dish for the family that is easy!
So easy. So tasty.
I really liked this recipe. I used Minute Rice instead of long grain rice and cooked it separately then mixed them together. It was very tasty.

I made this in a dutch oven. I used a whole red bell pepper instead of green, and used 1/2 cup of white rice and 1/4 cup orzo noodles since that was all I had. I winged the spices, and used salsa instead of chili sauce. I guess I really just used this recipe as a base, but it was delicious!

Enjoyed making it! Modified the recipe. Used Bushâ€™s Best Chili Beans (pinto beans) Mild Chili Sauce instead of the 1/2 C chili sauce. Used one beef bouillon cube in the water. Wow.. it tasted delicious!
This came out so amazing my family was drawn out from there rooms with the smell. Tastes amazing!! Would make it again
I added a half tap of nutmeg at the end as I love the flavor in almost anything.

This was delicious!!
I had rice leftover from a Chinese food meal, so I only added about a 1/2 cup water. I had no Chili Sauce, so I added more cumin and a little chili powder along with Ketchup. It worked!!

Very good, I used brown long grain rice & white cheddar. Otherwise followed the recipe exact. Only recommendation I would suggest is to soak the rice for an hour before, so as it would be a bit fluffier.

It was easy to make and I did use just one pan- my cast iron paella pan worked great. However, I thought it was a little bland and needed to add some hot sauce ( your flavor choice) when serving. I covered it tightly, cooked it on low, only stirred once as suggested and my rice was perfect. Finished off in broiler to get some nice color on the cheese
I have made this with shredded cooked chicken or ground beef. Delicious recipe
Simple, quick and deliciousâ€¦with only a few tweaks such as ground turkey instead of hamburger, smoked paprika and smokey barbecue sauce instead of chili sauce

this recipe serves and tastes like the ingredient, used actually very good.
The one caution is like that of most others submitted, if a component looks a little heavy or too much, you can always reduce the amount called for and add to taste as you mix and prep the dish
I used a little less rice and added the browned beef at the end of the simmer then added a little water then directly into a glass baking dish with grated cheese and cilantro
the simmer time took a little over 20 minutes

thats the fun about cooking and trying other recipes, experiment

I made this as written except for green pepper, which I seem to taste for days after eating. Thank-you for the recipe, it was quite good. I used to make excellent Spanish rice, but kept "tweaking" it until it became nasty and I couldn't remember where I started. This is very close to the one I used to make even though it uses different ingredients.

Very tasty dish, which we have made several times. My wife and I enjoyed. Fairly simple recipe. Most recently, I added a few red pepper flakes to give it a little more heat but it's not necessary and more of a personal preference.
This was very good. One key instruction missing in the recipe. After adding the rice, COVER THE POT and put on low. My rice came out just right doing it this way.

A very tasty dish and I will be making it again. I followed the directions and did not substitute anything; this was the first time I used Chile sauce and cumin in a recipe and I think those 2 ingredients help create the distinct flavor. I think you could even skip baking it especially if you're going to eat right away; cooking it in a large covered pan would do the trick. This same dish could be used as ingredients for burritos.
Needed more water than stated. Other than adding more water, made as is. Quite tasty.

This was a home run! My husband loved it and I loved it. I used rice I had on hand that was a mix of brown and white, I let it simmer as noted in directions, did not stir. But since brown rice takes longer to cook they were still a bit undercooked. However, my husband seemed to like it actually! It was super Spivey since I jazzed it up a bit to much with extra seasonings, we served with sour cream which took care of that extra spice. This will remain in my arsenal.
I made this last night and it was a big hit! I had some leftover taco meat so I used that and didnâ€™t add all the spices but all else was the same - very tasty and is on the repeat list!
really enjoyed this recipe
L lol

This was an enjoyable and simple to prepare meal. The flavor was good (although we expected somewhat spicier and added some mild hot sauce) and I decided to use Mexican cheese blend as opposed to sharp cheddar. One instruction that should be clarified is about the rice preparation. It doesn't state anything about needing to cover the pot while cooking the rice, which can have you come out with hard grains at the end. The liquid was insufficient to cook that amount of rice, a little more could have helped the rice to plump us and be tender. Otherwise, it was very good and I will definitely make it again. This is easily altered to fit individual tastes!
Yummy! Made (instant) rice on its own and then added when simmering (no need to then add any water). Used sriracha cause I didnâ€™t have any chilli sauce.

I enjoyed this but I didn't have chili sauce on hand so I used a bigger can of italian seasoned diced tomatoes, an extra cup of water, and threw in a 1/2 tsp of chili powder and a swirl of sriracha. added in corn for extra colour and flavour and topped with sour cream as another review suggested. will make it again.

Made it exactly as written. It was ok but like others have said it tasted rather blah. Wish I had read the comments first. If I make it again I will certainly add some of the ingredients others have suggested.
I love it. I would add a bit more rice, I used Jasmine. And I used sweet Thai chili sauce.

Es muy bien.

Maybe add black olive in top of cheese. Could be a little spcier
Skipped the added sugar. Great taste all around. Even Alec Baldwin's wife would approve.

It had a lot of flavor, my issue is that I shouldn't have to read the reviews before I make this to have it turn out right. I should know from cooking rice on its own, you are never supposed to lift the cover off when cooking or the rice will not completely cook. This recipe tells you to stir it occasionally. Don't do it unless you don't mind crunchy rice. THAT should be corrected. Then after it was done on the stove, I checked out reviews because after 30min. on the stove, rice not done. Thought maybe I could fix the faux pas by covering the dish in the over for 25-30 minutes. Wrong, it just made it like a soup. So don't cover it while in the oven. It finally solidified more after sitting. Would I make it again? Since I know not to pick up the cover and stire while on stove top, and I know not to cover it while cooking in oven, probably--very flavorful. I added more cheese.
I made it a one pot dish with my Dutch oven. Using bone broth instead of water. It was good and filling and easy. Nice recipe.

This was a big hit with our card group. My wife wife called it a keeper. I did make a few changes. I had a large number of tomatillos which I used in addition to the canned tomatos. I thought the flavor was a little sweet. I am considering using enchilada sauce instead of chilis sauce. I would also suggest increasing the cheese.
My husband loves this, better than the recipe I usually make. This is my go to recipe now.

Easy and good! Only edit I made was I used salsa instead of chili sauce because thatâ€™s what I had on hand and I made it all in cast iron so I only had to dirty one thing. Will definitely be on the regular meal rotation.
This recipe is amazing as is. I have made several times. My boyfriend asks for it, at least once a month!
Followed recipe exactly and it turned out so sweet. The chili sauce has so much sugar already, I should've gone with my instinct and not added the brown sugar.

I read many reviews and decided to follow the recipe except that I added more spices: garlic salt, red pepper flakes, taco seasoning. Made it in a deep dish frying pan. Sprinkled the cheese over it when it was done cooking and just covered the pan to melt the cheese. I think this will be good as a main dish or a side dish with chicken. Or, as someone suggested, use it to fill red and green bell peppers or as an appetizer, fill the mini bell peppers. Very much enjoyed this recipe.
It was good, but it made a better side dish.
No changes,

I wanted to make this because in grade school we had Spanish rice in the cafeteria often. This recipe was a hit. I had to make some changes based on what was in the fridge. Used ground chicken and yellow bell pepper. Didn't have chili sauce so we used Rotel tomatoes and added some hot sauce. I was pleased the brown sugar flavor came through along with the cumin for a tasty dish. My daughter said it was like "chili", we added a dollop of sour cream before serving.
This was pretty easy. I used 1/2 ground beef and 1/2 ground turkey. My husband ate it with tortilla chips, but I liked it as it was. Tomorrow we will try leftovers in wraps.

As someone who studied in Spain in college and in Mexico in high school, there is absolutely nothing "Spanish" about this dish. It is very misnamed. It's Tex-Mex perhaps but does not reflect at all on Iberian cuisine, which is is nothing like Mexican or Tex-Mex food.

My family all agreed that this was a good dish. But we also agreed that it was extremely bland. Will make it again but add way more seasoning then it says to add. Also might add corn and tomatoes with green chilies.
Great recipe - made it just as submitted. Thanks, we all loved it!
Good flavor but rice was crunchy. Not sure what happened.
Good flavors but the rice was nowhere near ready to eat.
Very yummy, but even with half the chili sauce, it was too hot for us.
Pretty tasty. I used Sriracha chili sauce and left out the cumin and Worcestershire. This complimented the cilantro nicely.
Delicious. Made in cast iron so one dish to wash. Very yummy.

This is a keeper. I used salsa instead of chili sauce because I didnâ€™t have any, and I used Mexican Style Rotel tomatoes because I didnâ€™t have diced tomatoes. Other than that I followed the recipe and it came out great. One note the rice took longer to cook but based on reviews I expected that.
Everyone loved this! I didn't have green peppers, but add black beans instead. I will always add the beans!

We all liked it. Used it to supplement as a soft taco filling. My changes were to cook everything in the same pan. I cooked the onion with the beef which was so lean, I didn't need to drain any grease. I added all remaining ingredients to the pan with just a bit more water and put a lid on the pan cooking almost 40 mins without removing the lid or stirring ( to make sure rice cooked). The only ingredient changes I made were some red and yellow pepper for the green as it was what I had and I used petite diced canned tomatoes. I did by mistake add 3/4 c. chile sauce as I read the recipe wrong. It didn't hurt it, and in fact I might just add the whole bottle next time because there wasn't much left in it. Once it had cooked on the stove top, I removed the lid, stirred it and sprinkled cheese on top then placed the pan in the oven for 10 mins. My husband commented later he really liked it. And he had tried to talk me out of making it!

It was really good. I made a couple substitutions based on what was in my cabinet. I used fire roasted tomatoes with garlic and green chile enchilada sauce.

I also used my Instant Pot to brown the meat along with the onions , then pressure cooked everything for 15 minutes. 

it came out really well.

Always looking for new recipes for ground beef. Saw this recipe and it looked delicious. Went to make it and realized I didnâ€™t have everything I needed. So I improvised and it really turned out great. I used a large can of tomato sauce and 1 can rotel tomatoes and the cup of water, 1 teas. cumin and chili powder, 3 garlic cloves and the onion. Browned the beef with the onion and garlic and salt and pepper. The rice was done in 30 minutes cooked on medium low. Used shredded Mexican cheese covered the pan and cooked on the stove till cheese melted. Served with chopped cilantro, sour cream and Franks hot sauce. Canâ€™t figure out why you need so many pans and place in the oven. Husband loved it.
Sooo good!!
I made a few changes for personal preferences.
Hubby thought it was ok, I thought it was good. I used a 14.5 oz can of tomato sauce instead of tomatoes, a can of rotelle that I put in blender, and some chili powder because I had no chili sauce.

I love this recipe and will definitely make this again! I subbed salsa for chili sauce because I didnâ€™t want the heat and it was great. I also used turkey sausage because I had it on hand but next time I will try with hamburger meat. Definitely a keeper!
i just used spanish rice for ease
Added corn for a bit extra taste. Should have doubled the recipe, not much leftovers.

I've been making this recipe for about 45 years. Can't remember where I found the recipe but I've always had people requesting this anytime there's a potluck. So easy and so good! Thanks for reprinting it. Forgot to mention - I always use Mexican style stewed tomatoes.

Agree with others that changes make this a much better recipe. I cooked the meat with garlic and 2 T. taco seasoning. Added salsa and tomato sauce. Left out brown sugar, reduced rice to 1/2 cup. Added water only when it seemed to need it. Used the same pan for both browning meat and creating casserole. Despite having less rice, it took more like an hour (on low) to get the rice cooked well enough to eat. But it was worth it in the end! Next time I might add corn too. There's a lot you can do with this dish.
The only changes I made, were using ground turkey and seasoning the ground turkey with taco seasoning. The whole family loved it!
My family loved it. I used a whole jar of chilie sauce, 1 cup of rice and used Rotel tomatoes with chiles. Awesome tasting!
Nice flabor & texture. I used ketchup istead of chili sauce, omitted cilantro. A great evety day meal, will make it again
Fast, easy and tastes great!!!!! It's become a member of the "ground beef" supper rotation.
Fast, easy and tastes great!!!!! It's become a member of the "ground beef" supper rotation.
It was yummy. Like other reviews state, don't stir when cooking rice. Also, I thought it was too salty so I'd omit the tspn of salt next time.

This recipe is aaaaaamazing!! My whole family loves it and now that the kids are grown, they are making it in their homes. The only tweak I have is doubling the tomatoes. I've added a bit of water too depending on how the rice cooks up...we don't like it dry. I serve it topped w sour cream. Yum!

Tonight, I made it with chicken (boneless breast, diced very small) per hubby's request. It's just as delicious! This has become a family recipe. Thank you!
Loved it. Cooked the beef in taco seasoning.
I didn't have chili sauce so I used a little hot sauce and added garlic. Very tasty dish.
I followed the recipe and it was very tasty. Pretty simple, yet hearty. I will make this again.
This was excellent. Husband had left-overs which he never has. Easy to make and delicious.

This is my favorite, fast spanish rice. I use the basics of the recipe but omit the brown sugar and use chicken broth instead of water. The liquid to rice ratio is perfect but you do need to cover the dish while simmering. You can substitute just about any seasons depending on your mood. I've also added a bay leaf and used chili powder instead of cumin. Sometimes I'll put a little Adobo in it as well. 

Well done Melodie!
Family loved it
I made it and my husband loved it. I still want to make it like my Mom did so instead of hamburger Iâ€™m going to use bacon!
This is super delicious, it loses something to reheating (I tried to reheat it on the stovetop with the help of steam) but right out of the over it's really good.
great recipe! Dutch oven worked great, make sure to keep it covered so the rice cooks. ate with sour cream too, filling and delicious!
When I made the Spanish Rice Bake, I served it in Acorn squash. Excellent
I used fresh tomatoes instead of canned. It was lovely ! RM

I love the flavor but SO disappointed that the rice didnâ€™t cook . Used Boca veggie crumbles instead of hamburger but that shouldnâ€™t have had an affect . Cooked at medium for 50 minutes but still had crunchie rice . Was thinking next time Iâ€™d cook rice first , but am concerned that when I then simmer , it wonâ€™t think . Maybe leave out the water if rice already cooked ?
Only change I made was to use Rotel tomatoes.

Came out excellent. Perfect for taking to a gathering. Made it for the first time going to a pot luck. Doubled the recipe and there was very little left, several people asked me for the recipe. If I were making it for just me I would add a little more spice to it but it was perfect for a crowd.

I thought this was delicious! will definitely make it again And try some different additions like corn but I followed the instructions this time. I didn't have any problems with my rice cooking. definitely a leeper!!
Need to cover it to get the rice to cook
Excellent, easy & has some kick! Goes well on tortillas or a great side dish.
It was ok but reminded me of stuffed peppers. The added cheese was nice but still it didnâ€™t knock my socks off.
No changes , delicious just the way it was. What was left on day one was devoured the next.
This was so delicious my family gobbled it up! I did substitute and omit some things. I left out the ground beef and worcestershire sauce. I changed out the chilie sauce for spaghetti sauce.

Absolutely delish.
I replaced the can of tomatoes (my kiddo won't eat them) with a bottle of pasta sauce, and did not add the chile sauce.
Also did not have Worcestershire Sauce, so I added a couple of teaspoons of bovril... and coriander instead of cumin.

I would like to still try the recipe as is, but the altered version I will certainly do again.

My usually picky child had two full helpings and wanted it cold in her lunchbox the next day.

I made this as suggested. I used jasmine rice and had no issues with it being undercooked. It was flavorful without being too spicy for my husband. My 13 month old grandson absolutely adored it and he is one picky eater!
Very tasty! Just the right combination of ingredients and spices. I will make this again
Simple, fast. great taste. Will make it again!
easy to make, very good flavor
Made accordimg to directions but no cilantro
Yum! This made a fantastic base for stuffed bell peppers! Due to sodium concerns, I decreased the sweet Chile sauce to 1/4 cup, but it still turned out with a delicious, unique flavor!
